New Records: 124 wickets for Tim Southee, the most in all of T20I cricket
Key Match Events: New Zealand 200 for 3 (Conway 92*, Allen 42) beat Australia (Maxwell 28, Southee 3-6, Santner 3-31) by 89 runs
Devon Conway batted through the entire 20 overs to make 92 off 58
Glenn Phillips took a spectacular catch to dismiss Marcus Stoinis
Mitchell Santner took 3 wickets for 31 runs
Tim Southee took 3 wickets for 6 runs
Pat Cummins was dismissed for 21 off 18 balls
Australia was bowled out for 111 in 17.1 overs
Pre-Game Insights: Australia won the toss and chose to bowl
Both teams expected rain and wanted to bowl first
Isa Guha reported that the pitch was damp and two-paced, giving an advantage to the bowlers early on
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand last beat Australia in Australia in December 2011
New Zealand's performance was seen as a significant achievement after 15 matches
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain was expected to affect the match
The pitch was under covers for most of the time before the match
Others: Australia needed to score the highest total ever made in the country to win a T20I
New Zealand's Glenn Phillips was compared to Superman for his catch
New Zealand's spin bowlers, Santner and Sodhi, played a crucial role in the match
Tim Southee's change of pace was highlighted as a key factor in his success
Trent Boult was noted for his effectiveness despite not being on New Zealand's retainer
